**About ENS Labs**

Ethereum Name Service (ENS) is a decentralized, permissionless naming system
built on the Ethereum blockchain that enables human-readable names (like
"myname.eth") to be linked to standard Ethereum addresses and other
distributed systems.

As one of the first protocols built on Ethereum, ENS has
[enabled](https://dune.com/ethereumnameservice/ens) over 3 million registered
.eth names, and over another 20 million ENS names from teams such as Coinbase,
Uniswap, and Linea, as well as integrations with hundreds of other apps,
wallets, protocols, and browsers in the crypto ecosystem.

ENS Labs has been driving the core development of the ENS protocol since 2018.
We created the ENS app, open-source libraries, and core smart contracts. We
are on a mission to make crypto-powered experiences as easy and accessible as
browsing the web. Join us as we build the next iteration of our protocol,
[ENSv2](https://discuss.ens.domains/t/ens-labs-development-proposal-ensv2-and-
native-l2-support/19232), and pioneer a more decentralized, flexible, and
scalable ENS for the future.

About the Role

ENS Labs is looking for an experienced **DevOps Engineer** to own and operate
the infrastructure that makes ENS resolve quickly and reliably across chains.
Youâ€™ll run the metadata service, CCIP-Read gateways, multichain indexers, and
emerging Namechain/L2 nodes. Work spans infra management, automation/CI/CD,
observability, security/keys, and incident response in a small, remote team.

What Youâ€™ll Do

  * **Infrastructure management**

    * Plan, implement, and maintain cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP), including Kubernetes cluster management, container orchestration, networking/security, performance optimization, and scaling.

  * **Automation & CI/CD**

    * **CI/CD:** Own GitHub Actions pipelines for core services; create/maintain Infrastructure as Code; automate builds/tests/deploys, release/versioning, and security scans.

    * **End-to-end testing:** Own Docker/Compose-based E2E environments integrated with CI; seed realistic data and gate releases on failures.

  * **Core ENS services**

    * **Metadata service:** Operate and harden `metadata.ens.domains`(HA, caching, secrets, rollouts, SLOs).

    * **CCIP-Read gateways:** Deploy/scale gateways, manage signing keys/rotation, monitor off-chain lookups/latency, uphold SLAs.

    * **Indexing:** Run ENSIndexer across L1/L2 with private RPCs; manage Postgres (tuning, backups, schema changes); keep indexing lag low.

    * **Namechain/L2:** Stand up and maintain L2 nodes; plan upgrades, snapshots, and monitoring; coordinate with external providers (RPC, provers).

  * **Reliability, security, and collaboration**

    * Instrument on-chain/service metrics; build alerts/dashboards; lead incident response and post-mortems.

    * Enforce least-privilege access, secret hygiene, and key custody for gateways and infra.

    * Partner with protocol/app engineers; maintain runbooks and concise architecture docs

Who You Are

  * 5+ years in DevOps/SRE/Infra running production systems (Kubernetes/containers) on AWS and/or GCP

  * Strong CI/CD with GitHub Actions; hands-on with IaC (Terraform/Pulumi/Ansible)

  * Automation in TypeScript/Node, Python, or Go

  * Observability youâ€™ve shipped: metrics, logs, alerts, dashboards (Prometheus/Grafana + centralized logging)

  * Postgres basics (migrations, performance, backups) and Redis caching

  * Security-first operator: Familiar with industry standards and best practices; able to serve as front-line triage for production/security issues and escalate when appropriate.

  * Familiar with Ethereum/L2 concepts and operating nodes/RPC-driven services

  * Clear communicator who documents well and thrives in a remote, async environment.

Itâ€™s a Plus, If You Have

  * Shipped or contributed to ENS, CCIP-Read gateways, ENSNode/ENSIndexer, or Ponder-style indexers

  * Hands-on with zkEVM/rollups (Linea, Scroll, zkSync), prover/verification infra, or cross-chain messaging

  * Experience hosting/operating provers or managing relationships with node/prover providers

  * Familiarity with trust-minimized gateways and key/cert rotation patterns

  * Meaningful open-source contributions showcasing operational depth

ENS Labs is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and are
committed to fostering an inclusive, supportive environment for all team
members. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds and experiences.

**About the Company**

Our client stands as the premier residential construction company in the ADU
(Accessory Dwelling Unit) market in Sacramento. Founded on the pillars of
family tradition and exceptional craftsmanship over three decades ago, the
company has successfully transformed into a cutting-edge, technology-driven
enterprise without compromising its core values of quality, innovation, and
customer satisfaction. As the #1 leader in Sacramento's ADU market, they
continue to set industry standards, driving innovation and excellence in every
project they undertake.

  * HQ Location: Sacramento, California (USA)

  * Industry: ADUs, Residential Construction, Prop-tech

  * Product or service: ADU design and construction

  * Average deal size: 200k

  * Remote Worldwide: 7 AM to 3 PM PST

Our client's **mission** is to revolutionize living spaces by delivering
exceptional ADU solutions that maximize property value and enhance the quality
of life. Our client combines traditional craftsmanship with state-of-the-art
technology to meet and exceed the evolving needs of homeowners.  
  
**The Opportunity**

As a **Remote Project Manager** , you'll be at the heart of transforming
families' lives by helping them create beautiful, functional living spaces.
You'll coordinate multiple ADU construction projects from start to finish,
serving as the vital connection between clients realizing their dreams,
skilled subcontractors, and our client's award-winning team. Join a
construction company with over 30 years of excellence, where you will help
families build equity, gain rental income, and create homes for the people
they love.

**What You'll Do**

  * Negotiate with clients and subcontractors on additional payments, change orders, and disputed issues to ensure fair outcomesâ€‹â€‹

  * Coordinate with clients and internal stakeholders through Zoom, email, and chat platforms, managing 20+ concurrent conversationsâ€‹â€‹

  * Manage project documentation, including contracts, estimates, scope of work statements, and legal case materialsâ€‹â€‹

  * Translate construction information clearly between technical teams and non-technical clientsâ€‹â€‹

  * Facilitate cross-cultural communication between English-speaking clients and Russian-speaking team membersâ€‹

  * Maintain professionalism and patience when managing challenging client situations throughout the project lifecycleâ€‹â€‹

**What You Bring**

  * 1+ years of project or operations ownership experience in Project Management, Product Management, or Operations Lead roles within B2C or B2B2C environments

  * Ability to manage multiple projects, coordinate the schedule of subcontractors, and construction managers

  * Proficiency in English (C1) + fluency in Russian, Ukrainian, or other Slavic languages

  * Understanding of budgeting, cost control, and the ability to process large amounts of information

  * Self-organized with strong time management skills and high attention to detail

  * Proficiency in using modern project management software and AI tools

  * Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, team player

  *  _Bonus:_ experience in residential construction project management

**Key Success Drivers**

  * Passionate about negotiation and problem-solving with integrity and transparencyâ€‹â€‹

  * Client-focused with meticulous attention to detail and a self-organized approach to complex projectsâ€‹â€‹

  * Results-driven with an ownership mindset, accountability, and commitment to meeting project outcomesâ€‹â€‹

  * Adaptable and comfortable working in fast-paced, cross-cultural environments with changing prioritiesâ€‹â€‹

  * Exceptional communicator with diplomatic approach, collaborative spirit, and commitment to continuous learning

**Why Join?**

  * Employment Type: full-time

  * Work Environment: 100% fully remote with set working hours, 7 am to 3 pm PST

  * Base salary: $2,000/month + unlimited bonus

  * Paid Time Off (PTO) policy: vacation, sick days, and company holidays

  * Clear career growth opportunities

  * Digital-first and paperless culture, supportive team

  * Work with a #1 leader in the ADU market in Sacramento (California), known for quality and innovation

**Interviewing Process**

  * HR screening - Lavendo

  * HR screening - Client

  * Level 1: Virtual interview with the Permit Manager and Heads of Departments (Sales & Production)

  * Level 2: Take-home test assignment

  * Reference and Background Checks: conducted after successful interviews

  * Job Offer: provided to the selected candidate

 _We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and are committed to equal
employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin,
age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic
information, veteran status, gender identity, or expression, sexual
orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal,
state or local law._

### About Us

Circle is building the worldâ€™s leading all-in-one platform for online
communities. We make it possible for creators, coaches, educators, and
businesses to bring together their audience with engaging discussions, live
streams, events, chat, courses, and payments â€” all in one place, all under
their own brand.

Weâ€™re proud to be a fully remote company of around 200 (and growing!) team
members from 30+ countries around the world. We seek exceptional individuals
around the world, set them up to do the best work of their lives, and in turn,
create a meaningful impact in their own lives. We don't track hours, but we do
manage for high expectations very closely. We collaborate across time zones,
are highly async, and like to document a lot.

Twice a year, we bring the whole company together in beautiful places around
the world for our company offsites. So far, weâ€™ve hosted offsites in Turkey,
Portugal, Mexico, Thailand, Colombia, Italy, Ireland, and more, with still
more to come!

Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more about
working at Circle.

### Sales at Circle

Circle is unlike any other software company in the world. We've scaled to
**$50M+ ARR while achieving profitability** â€”a feat driven in part by our
sales team's ability to move upmarket and close increasingly larger deals
sizes, while our world class product led growth function captures the rest.

We're on a clear path from $50M to $250M ARR, over the next few years and our
sales teamâ€™s ability to sell our highest tier plans to our core customer and
new customers types is a big piece of the puzzle.

Every seller works at Circle because we have the best product. We win because
of our product - nothing touches it.

### Our sales team

In many ways, we're still a startup with the energy and opportunity that comes
with it, while building the foundation of a world-class sales organization.
Weâ€™re small, growing - the perfect place to carve our your career.

**A bit about our Sales team:**

  * **Servant leadership culture** \- We're obsessed with enabling our reps for success and creating the best environment for growth.
  * **Diverse customer base** \- You'll sell to budding solopreneurs and enterprise companies, balancing transactional deals with longer consultative sales cycles.
  * **Growth mindset** \- We're looking for people who invest in themselves relentlessly.
  * **Genuinely customer-obsessed** \- When we say it, we mean it. We solve problems with customer experience and customer value first, even when it means walking away from a deal.
  * **We work hard** \- It's sales. There will be highs and lows. You get the freedom to run your own business and the pressure of hitting your number and climbing the leaderboard.
  * **High-performance culture** \- We hold a high bar and expect both effort and outcomes. There's pressure in that, but you also get to be part of a winning team.
  * **Tech-enabled** \- We're hyper-focused on equipping our teams with cutting-edge tools and technology. We want people excited to lean into new tech.
  * **Competitive compensation** \- We pay well for top performers.

### Where we work

Circle is a 100% remote, distributed company. This team is fully distributed.
You'll need to be a self-starter who delivers high-quality work with speed,
then enjoys your personal life. We gather twice yearly for company offsites to
build connection and align on our vision.

We're generally looking for people in **North American time zones** for this
role.

### The impact you will have

**Drive Revenue Growth**

  * Close $20K-$100K ACV new business deals by managing prospects from trial through contract signature.
  * Execute expansion opportunities by managing a book of existing customers after youâ€™ve sold previously.

**Execute Consultative Sales**

  * Run discovery conversations that uncover customer needs, challenges, and success criteria
  * Deliver customized demos that showcase Circle's value proposition for diverse use cases across creators, brands, and enterprises
  * Navigate complex buying processes, engaging multiple stakeholders and decision-makers
  * Build compelling business cases and ROI models for executive stakeholders
  * Develop mutual evaluation plans and success criteria with prospects

**Continuously Learn and Improve**

  * Stay current on product releases and understand how customers leverage new features (it's changing daily)
  * Educate yourself by reading, listening to podcasts, and learning from teammates
  * Go above and beyond your quota to help your teammates and the company succeed

**Be a great Teammate**

  * Contribute your expertise to evolve our sales methodology and playbooks
  * Share wins, losses, and learnings openly to help the entire team improve
  * Jump in to help teammates when they need support, even when you're crushing your own number
  * Bring your voice to the tableâ€”your experience will help refine our sales processes
  * Celebrate others' success as much as your own
  * Create an environment where everyone can thrive, not just survive

### What we're looking for

**Required Experience & Skills**

  * **3-5+ years of closing experience** in B2B SaaS or technology sales with $30K-$50K ACV deals
  * **Proven track record** of exceeding quota and ranking as a top performer
  * **Consultative selling expertise** with ability to conduct deep discovery and build value-based business cases
  * **Proficiency in English** at CEFR C2 / ILR Level 5 (spoken, written, reading)
  * **Strong alignment** with [Circle's values](https://circle.so/careers)

**Core Competencies**

  * **Relationship building** \- You quickly establish rapport and find common ground with diverse prospects
  * **Business Acumen** \- You understand what makes a business run, and how to find the risks and the opportunities.
  * **Internal locus of control** \- Youâ€™re in control of your outcomes. You hold yourself to a high bar.
  * **Intellectual curiosity** \- You research prospects, ask thoughtful questions, and continuously learn
  * **Technical aptitude** \- You're comfortable with SaaS platforms and automation tools (Zapier, etc.)
  * **Data-driven mindset** \- You analyze metrics to understand performance and optimize your approach
  * **Exceptional organization** \- You juggle multiple deals while maintaining meticulous attention to detail
  * **Customer-first mentality** \- You prioritize fit over commission, disqualifying prospects when Circle isn't right for them.
  * **Outstanding written communication** \- You craft clear, persuasive emails and internal documentation

### $150,000 - $190,000 USD OTE (depending on experience)

_This role includes variable compensation at 50% base, 50% variable._

_The cash compensation range shown is a starting point. In addition to equity,
benefits and perks, your cash compensation is subject to an annual review and
increase on a once per year basis._

### The fun stuff

  * Fully remote: work from anywhere in the world!
  * Autonomy and trust to do your job: we care about outcomes over everything else.
  * Paid time away: all employees are given 35 days of PTO annually. We also offer a paid sabbatical after 5 years.
  * Generous U.S. benchmarked compensation and startup equity no matter where you are in the world.*
  * Awesome medical coverage with 100% coverage for you and your family, or medical reimbursement options where applicable!*
  * Parental leave for parents expanding their family, or just starting one.
  * Home office stipend to help you get up and running.
  * Learning & development stipend to help you level up your professional skills.
  * Annual bonus potential for roles that don't already receive variable income or commission.
  * Company retreats: Twice a year, the Circle team gets together for a fully paid company retreat in incredible places around the world! Weâ€™ve had past retreats in Colombia, Portugal, and Mexico, with more planned on the horizon.
  * Check out our [Careers](https://careers.circle.so/) page for more.

*_Your role, location and unique circumstance may affect this._

### Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

As a fully-remote international company, diversity is baked into our DNA.
Hereâ€™s how our CEO, Sid Yadav, frames our hiring mission: â€œletâ€™s find talent
in underserved and under-represented corners of the world, set them up to do
the best work of their lives, and in turn, change their life.â€ To achieve this
hiring mission, we offer competitive U.S. benchmarked compensation no matter
where someoneâ€™s located in the world, and we proactively seek candidates who
expand representation of backgrounds, cultures and lived experiences in our
teams.

### Equal Employment Opportunity

Circle is an equal opportunity employer and as such, we do not discriminate on
the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity,
national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by
applicable laws. If you require any accommodations during the recruitment
process, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

### How We Use Candidate Data

At Circle, we are committed to protecting your personal information. As a job
applicant, the personal data you provide to us is collected and processed in
accordance with the **General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)** in the EU
and the **California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)**. This notice outlines the
types of personal information we collect, the purpose for collecting it, and
your rights.

**Information We Collect:** We collect the following categories of personal
information from job applicants:

  * Contact information (such as name, email address, phone number)
  * Employment history and qualifications
  * Education history
  * References and any other information you choose to share with us during the application process

**Purpose of Collection:** We collect this information for the following
purposes:

  * To assess your qualifications and suitability for the position
  * To communicate with you during the recruitment process
  * To comply with legal and regulatory obligations

**Your Rights Under GDPR and CCPA:** You have the following rights regarding
your personal information:

  * The right to request access to the personal information we hold about you.
  * The right to request the deletion of your personal information, subject to certain legal exceptions.
  * The right to opt out of the sale of your personal information (Note: We do not sell personal information).

For more information about how we handle your personal data or to exercise
your rights, please refer to our full [Privacy
Policy](https://circle.so/privacy).

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that you have read and
understood this privacy notice.

postTitle: IT Infrastructure Intern (L1 Support) (remote-only opportunity) at CloudLinux
jobTitle: IT Infrastructure Intern (L1 Support) (remote-only opportunity) at CloudLinux
descContent:
Build your operational muscle, ship real improvements, and learn how modern
infrastructure actually runs.

This isnâ€™t a â€œreset passwords all dayâ€ internship. Youâ€™ll be the first line
for CloudLinuxâ€™s internal infrastructure, working from clear runbooks, fixing
real problems, and automating away toilâ€”with a mentor and a team that expects
you to ship meaningful work. Weâ€™re looking for people who enjoy tinkering with
Linux + Networks + VMs & Containers + Clouds, automating away toil, and
applying product thinking and empathy toward users. If thatâ€™s not you, this
role wonâ€™t be a good fit.

**Key responsibilities:**

  * Triage and resolve L1 tickets using runbooks; escalate clearly when needed.
  * Handle SSO/access, VPN, DNS/domain, light Atlassian admin, and basic provisioning.
  * Automate repetitive work with Bash/Python/Terraform/Ansible; keep docs and runbooks sharp.
  * Support internal teams like customersâ€”focus on quality, speed, and reducing friction.
  * Learn SRE fundamentals hands-on: reliability, performance, capacity, and automation.

**Requirements**

**Must-have skills:**

  * Basic grasp of software, networking, and cybersecurity.
  * Strong problem-solving skills, curiosity, and passion for innovation.
  * Desire to learn continuously and read broadly.
  * Confident Linux user (terminal, logs, ping/traceroute/dig).
  * Bash, basic Python, Git.
  * Clear English and attention to detail.
  * Studying or recently graduated in CS/IT (or equivalent experience).

**Nice-to-have skills:**

  * SRE basics, Atlassian admin, DNS/TLS/VPN, CI/CD, monitoring, clouds, containers, IaC.

**Benefits**

  * Work on real project tasks in an Agile team

  * A strong focus on professional development with opportunities for learning and growth:
    * Interesting and challenging projects,
    * Mentor and other knowledge-exchange programs, 
  * Fully remote work with flexible working hours, that allows you to schedule your day and work from any location worldwide;
  * 10 days of national holidays, and unlimited sick leaves to ensure you maintain a healthy work-life balance;
  * Compensation for private medical insurance;
  * Co-working and gym/sports reimbursement;
  * The opportunity to receive a reward for the most innovative idea that the company can patent, fostering a culture of creativity and innovation.

_By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal
data as described in our Privacy Policy (_[_https://cloudlinux.com/candidate-
privacy-notice_](https://cloudlinux.com/candidate-privacy-notice) _), which
provides detailed information on how we maintain and handle your data._

Zencargo is looking for an experienced Product Manager to work in one of our
cross-functional Experience Teams.

  

The role works alongside our other Product Managers to deliver our product
strategy which will help us realise our vision of a world with smarter trade,
and our mission of making our customersâ€™ supply chain their competitive
advantage.

  

Our platform is a web application with features that enable customers to
capture their products and suppliers; plan and book their shipping; track
shipments to arrival; pay for shipping; and analyse their supply chain
performance. We provide the platform, combined with our freight services, to
major retailers across the globe, with a particular focus on the UK and EU. We
have an exciting vision for the platform over the coming years so there will
be opportunities to build market-leading and market-first features that
satisfy and delight our users.

We are looking for candidates who

  * appreciate complexity and love distilling vast information down to its essence
  * value outcomes over outputs and adapt to what they learn
  * love building relationships with a squad to form a high-performing team
  * take ownership and are comfortable working with stakeholders across seniority levels

  
  

  
  

Key Responsibilities

  * Carry out user research and analyse opportunities by staying close to our customers, suppliers, and competitors
  * Work with the wider business to understand requirements and facilitate product launches
  * Collaborate with designers & software engineers to develop solutions that meet usersâ€™ needs and further the aims of the product strategy
  * Support engineers to iteratively deliver releases based on feedback led by you
  * Communicate progress and promote your teamâ€™s efforts to all stakeholders internally 
  * Define and track the metrics which show the impact of your teamâ€™s work
  * Act as the customerâ€™s voice in prioritisation

  

  
  

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

  * Worked as a product manager or adjacent role in a software organisation
  * Demonstrable passion for solving customer problems
  * Focused on delivering and measuring outcomes
  * An ability to translate user needs and product strategy into successful solutions
  * A curiosity to explore and communicate new problem spaces
  * Excellent collaboration skills both leading execution across teams and influencing across the organisation

[**Original job post link**](https://garden3d.notion.site/Content-Producer-
Part-Time-2a6131fea2c780a696f0ec3dfbfa7ac8?pvs=73)  

## ğŸŒ About garden3d

We are worker owned creative collective, innovating on everything from brands
and IRL communities to IoT devices and cross platform apps. We share profit,
open source everything, spin out new businesses, and invest in exciting ideas
through financial and/or in-kind contributions.
([garden3d](https://garden3d.net/))

Our client roster includes [Google](https://www.google.com/),
[Stripe](https://stripe.com/), [Figma](https://www.figma.com/),
[Hinge](https://hinge.co/), [Black Socialists in
America](https://blacksocialists.us/), [ACLU](https://www.aclu.org/),
[Pratt](https://www.pratt.edu/),
[Parsons](https://www.newschool.edu/parsons/),
[Mozilla](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/), [The Nobel
Prize](https://www.nobelprize.org/), [MIT](https://www.mit.edu/),
[Gnosis](https://www.gnosis.io/), [Etsy](https://www.etsy.com/) &
[Gagosian](https://gagosian.com/). Weâ€™re the software team behind innovative
products like [The Light Phone](https://www.thelightphone.com/) &
[Mill](https://www.mill.com/), and we a global, decentralized community space
collective called [Index Space](https://www.index-space.org/).

We think of our garden3d as collective for creative people, prioritizing a
happy, talented, and diverse studio culture. We offer competitive pay,
comprehensive benefits, and progressive policies. We work on projects that
bring value to our world, and we balance deep care for the work we do with a
genuine curiosity about life outside of our jobs. (And, yes, we can back all
of that up!)

**Sanctuary Computer â€” Development**

At [Sanctuary Computer](https://www.sanctuary.computer/) weâ€™re building a
different type of technology shop â€“ one that prioritizes close collaboration
between the client and the craftsperson. Our projects range from design-
forward websites, to robust web apps, to native mobile development.

**XXIX â€” Design**

When we started [XXIX](https://www.xxix.co/) in 2013, we set out to create a
different kind of design studio and weâ€™ve thrived because we continually ask
what a creative practice can be. Weâ€™re building a radically different kind of
organization that values autonomy, growth, transparency, and shared
responsibility.

**Index Space â€” Community**

A network of physical spaces all around the world, [Index](https://www.index-
space.org/) provides space for the exchange of knowledge and tools. We nurture
trust within the creative community through generosity and abundance of ideas
and care.

**Seaborne â€” Sustainability**

[Seaborne](https://www.seaborne.nyc/) work withs purpose driven companies that
want to take meaningful action on contemporary social and environmental
issues, guiding them through each step of the way from strategy to
storytelling.

## â›°ï¸ The Content Producer role

We're seeking a Content Producer to transform raw audio, video, and other
materials into compelling short-form videos, polished audio assets, and
interactive content for garden3d. You'll identify the most impactful
soundbites and moments, then craft them into narratives that authentically
represent our collective across social media, long-form platforms, and
interactive experiences.

Your editorial eye and taste are key. We need someone who instinctively
recognizes what resonates. What stops the scroll, builds connection, and feels
distinctly garden3d. You'll develop a cohesive visual and sonic signature
while working autonomously to bring stories to life with strong pacing,
composition, and narrative sensibility.

Technically, you should be proficient in video editing, audio production,
color grading, and motion graphics using tools like Adobe Premiere, After
Effects, and audio editing software like Ableton Live or similar. You'll add
transitions, effects, and captions to deliver professional-grade content
optimized for each platform, working efficiently across formats and technical
requirements.

## **Responsibilities:**

  * **Content Strategy & Curation**
    * Review and audit raw video, audio, and multimedia assets from across garden3d studios
    * Identify standout moments, quotes, and visual elements that align with brand voice and platform best practices
    * Develop content calendars and storylines that showcase our work, culture, and values
    * Stay ahead of platform trends and algorithm changes to maximize reach and engagement
  * **Brand Voice & Creative Direction**
    * Develop and maintain a cohesive visual and sonic identity across all content
    * Exercise strong editorial judgment to ensure content authentically represents garden3d's values and aesthetic
    * Experiment with new formats, styles, and approaches to keep content fresh and engaging
    * Balance creativity with strategic goals to drive awareness, engagement, and community building
  * **Video Production & Editing**
    * Edit short-form video content optimized for Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, YouTube Shorts, and other platforms
    * Apply color grading, motion graphics, transitions, and effects to create polished, on-brand content
    * Add captions, subtitles, and text overlays for accessibility and engagement
    * Ensure proper aspect ratios, file formats, and technical specifications for each platform
  * **Audio Production**
    * Clean, mix, and master audio from interviews, podcasts, and internal recordings
    * Create audio snippets and soundbites for social media, podcasts, and promotional use
    * Add music, sound design, and audio effects to enhance storytelling
    * Optimize audio levels and quality for various distribution channels
  * **Collaboration & Communication**
    * Work closely with leadership and team members to understand project goals and messaging priorities
    * Provide creative input and recommendations on how to best capture and share our work
    * Communicate progress, timelines, and deliverables clearly and proactively
    * Operate autonomously while remaining open to feedback and iteration
  * **Performance & Optimization**
    * Monitor content performance metrics and audience engagement across platforms
    * Use insights to refine content strategy and improve future output
    * Test different formats, hooks, and storytelling approaches to maximize impact
    * Archive and organize assets for future use and reference

## Qualifications

This is a great opportunity for someone looking to make a significant impact
in a growing, dynamic company. Youâ€™ll be a key partner in shaping our
financial future while ensuring we remain a sustainable and thriving
organization.

Based on the responsibilities of this role, we think the right candidate has
at least 5+ years in a similar role, sporting the following experience and
skills:

**ğŸ”‘ Must have:**

  * 5+ years of experience in video editing and content production, with a strong portfolio demonstrating expertise in short-form video for social media platforms
  * Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects, and other industry-standard video editing tools
  * Strong audio production skills, including experience with mixing, mastering, and audio editing software (e.g., Ableton Live, Adobe Audition, or similar)
  * Demonstrated editorial judgment and ability to identify compelling moments and narratives from raw footage
  * Deep understanding of platform-specific best practices and content optimization for Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, YouTube Shorts, and emerging platforms
  * Experience with color grading, motion graphics, and visual effects to create polished, professional content
  * Strong storytelling abilities with excellent pacing, composition, and narrative sensibility
  * Ability to work autonomously while managing multiple projects and deadlines efficiently
  * Exceptional analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy
  * Able to be online between Pacific Standard Time (UTC-8) and Central European Time (UTC+2).

**ğŸ§ Nice-to-have:**

  * Fluency in AI tools like RunwayML, Midjourney, Fuser Studio, etc
  * Fluency in node-based tools like TouchDesigner, MaxMSP
  * Experience with OBS, live streaming and real-time content production
  * Knowledge of 3D animation, CGI, or immersive media production
  * Background in documentary filmmaking or long-form storytelling
  * Experience working with creative agencies, design studios, or technology collectives
  * Proficiency with additional creative tools such as DaVinci Resolve, Final Cut Pro, or Blender
  * Background in photography or graphic design to complement video work
  * Experience creating content for creative audiences, strategy consultancies, and/or thought leadership platforms
  * Ability to create interactive content or experiences for web and mobile platforms
  * Experience with community management and audience engagement strategies
  * Understanding of content performance metrics and data-driven optimization strategies

## ğŸ§— Who you are

The person weâ€™re looking for is happy, relaxed and easy to get along with and
appreciates a commitment to a culture of transparency, non-dictatorial
leadership styles, and alternative methodologies. Theyâ€™re flexible on anything
except conceits that will lower their usually outstanding work quality. They
work â€œsmartâ€ by carefully managing their workflow and team.

## ğŸ¤ **How we interview**

After you submit your application, a member of our team will reach out. Our
interview process starts with an intro call to answer any questions you have
about the role and to learn a bit more about your experience and interests.

From there, weâ€™ll follow up with a panel interview call where you get to meet
a few members of our team, to openly discuss some of our challenges and ensure
your skills and interests align with where weâ€™re going as a business.

For qualified candidates, the process wraps with a reference call, and an
offer to follow.

## ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ­ **How we work:**

We believe that thereâ€™s a better balance between the poles of freelancing &
full time, and for that reason Sanctuary works differently to most shops:

  * [**Transparency & Ownership:**](https://sanctucompu.substack.com/p/our-open-source-2020-profit-and-loss) We release out Profit & Loss statements to the community each year, open source our best ideas, and talk business & money with everyone in the company. Weâ€™re proud to run our business with integrity, and for that reason we share everything with our team & community.
  * [**150% Carbon Negative** :](https://negative.sanctuary.computer/) Our studio offsets 150% of the carbon we use to do business each year, dated back to our founding in 2015. We turn down work that is not in-line with our morals, and we encourage our peers to do the same. [We have been certified climate neutral since 2021](https://twitter.com/sanctucompu/status/1385282161197060100).
  * [**Strong Morals:**](https://sanctucompu.substack.com/p/our-moral-compass) Since our founding, we've turned down somewhere between $1mm - $2mm of work that didn't meet our moral standards. (Most of that was DTC brands that can't show a valid sustainability initiative).
  * **Async & Decentralized:** We use tools optimized for calm, thoughtful communication, and opt for async whenever possible. We fight hard to maintain our focus time.
  * **Remote Friendly:** Our company is fluent in remote work, making our workplace more decentralized, and democratized in the process.
  * **Ideas & Products:** In our spare studio time, we work to build our own open source or internal products to diversify & bolster our income. We create amazing technology products for our clients, so why not for the studio?

**â†’ Read more on our[Substack, over here](https://sanctucompu.substack.com/),
or our [Medium, over there](https://medium.com/sanctuary-computer-inc).**

**Quick tip!** Adding a **Loom recording** to your profile in our form to
showcase your skillset can really make your application stand out!

  

Please mention the word **RESPONSIVE** when applying to show you read the job
post completely (#RMTU3LjUwLjE0My4yMQ==). This is a feature to avoid fake spam
applicants. Companies can search these words to find applicants that read this
and instantly see they're human.  
  

## Salary and compensation

  
$40,000 â€” $60,000/year

postTitle: Software Engineer, Core Replication - Software Engineer, Connect
jobTitle: Software Engineer, Core Replication - Software Engineer, Connect
descContent:
Redpanda Data | REMOTE | Full-time

Redpanda is pioneering the Agentic Data Plane (ADP) - a new category in AI
infrastructure that makes it simple and secure to connect AI agents with
enterprise data and systems. Built on a multi-modal data streaming engine,
Redpanda empowers agentic applications that reason and act in real-time with
speed, autonomy, and precision. Global leaders including Activision Blizzard,
Cisco, Moody's, Texas Instruments, Vodafone and 2 of the top 5 banks in the
U.S. rely on Redpanda to process hundreds of terabytes of data a day. Backed
by premier venture investors Lightspeed, GV and Haystack VC, Redpanda is a
diverse, people-first organization with teams distributed around the globe.

  * Design, develop and maintain job aides: FAQs, reference sheets, manuals, etc.
  * Maintain and update software help manual and release documents
  * Provide end-user application support (end user support requires access to customer data which includes protected health information) provide Customer Service support as needed via phone, web-based and/or email
  * Understands and complies with all company Privacy and Security standards
  * Employee may not use or disclose any protected health information, except as otherwise permitted, or required, by law
  * Analyze daily news articles and accurately input relevant data into the software
  * Perform other duties as required

  

  
  

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

  * A good working knowledge of web applications is essential to this role. Experience in healthcare IT, clinical informatics, or Healthcare Fraud, Waste and Abuse (FWA) is strongly desired.
  * Analytical troubleshooting skills and approach to work
  * Ability to absorb complex technical information and communicate the information clearly
  * Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written)
  * Excellent problem-solving skills
  * Experience working on SLAs and deadlines
  * Proven customer service skills
  * Ability to work under pressure
  * Ability to explain technical elements in a manner easily understood by those without a technical background
  * Advanced knowledge using web-based applications
  * Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office products â€“ Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint
  * This job requires access to confidential and sensitive information, requiring ongoing discretion and secure information management

  

  
  

Benefits

  * Medical, Dental & Vision insurance
  * 401(k) retirement savings with employer match
  * Vacation and sick paid time off
  * 8 paid holidays
  * Paid maternity/paternity leave
  * Disability & Life insurance
  * Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
  * Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  * Free on-site fitness center (for local employees)
  * Professional and career development initiatives
  * Remote work eligible

  

**Remote Work Requirements**

  * Must have high speed Internet (satellite is not allowed for this role) with a minimum speed of 25mbs download and 5mbs upload.

  

  

_Healthcare Fraud Shield is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to
diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,
color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,
disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable
law._

postTitle: Product Designer, Customer Success Engineer, Product Engineer (full stack)
jobTitle: Product Designer, Customer Success Engineer, Product Engineer (full stack)
descContent:
Railway | Product Design, Customer Success Engineer, Product Eng (full stack)| REMOTE (Worldwide) | <https://jobs.ashbyhq.com/Railway?utm_source=DayMzWzJ0P>

Tired of trying to beat kube into shape? Does writing YAML to ship code fill
you with utter dread? Dream of a future where deploying software is simple,
and you don't need an army of infrastructure engineers to build that perfect
janky bash scriptâ„¢ to make life easy?

We're Railway, and we think infrastructure can be better. So far we've built
out a platform loved by hundreds of thousands of users who simply tell us
"Give me Postgres", "Deploy this repo", and we make it happen

Fair warning! The problems are complex: home-rolled hypervisors, cut-above
container orchestration, over/under/whateverlay networks, virtio device
drivers, edge proxies, IAM that doesn't suck, kitchen sinks - we need to build
it and we're looking for likeminded individuals who think this stuff is fun.

Three open roles (apply below!):

+Product Designer: -Apply here:
([https://jobs.ashbyhq.com/Railway/6fb07755-acd8-4400-9de3-fa5...](https://jobs.ashbyhq.com/Railway/6fb07755-acd8-4400-9de3-fa598e4eeb7d?utm_source=DayMzWzJ0P))

+Product Engineer (full-stack): -Apply here:
([https://jobs.ashbyhq.com/Railway/6ddcfe47-6cce-469b-ba6d-4f0...](https://jobs.ashbyhq.com/Railway/6ddcfe47-6cce-469b-ba6d-4f0e83440c9d?utm_source=DayMzWzJ0P))

product-engineerin...](https://blog.railway.app/p/team-spotlight-product-
engineering))

See you soon, and happy shipping.

postTitle: Tech Lead Engineer, Senior/Staff Backend/Full-stack/Frontend Engineers
jobTitle: Tech Lead Engineer, Senior/Staff Backend/Full-stack/Frontend Engineers
descContent:
GoGoGrandparent (YC S16) | FULLY REMOTE | Full-time | Able to work 4+ hours overlap with mainland US (global) | 1 x Tech Lead Engineer + 3 x Senior/Staff Backend/Full-stack/Frontend Engineers | $100k-$200k (partially location-dependent)

Build high-quality, robust engineering at the rarest of things - a Silicon
Valley startup that is both wholesome AND profitable. We have 8-figure
revenue, are YC-backed, and growing fast.

Tech stack (required): Back-end (Node, Typescript, MySQL, REST* / GraphQL),
Front-end (Vue.js), deploy (AWS, Docker/K8s) Minimum 5 years experience (with
Node or Vue).

2-stage interview process.

If you want to help older adults and people with disabilities, send your
LinkedIn/CV to recruitment@gogograndparent.com (keep it brief) or apply at
<https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/gogograndparent/jobs>

ShiftUp | Staff Software Engineer | Remote | <https://shiftupai.com>

Hiring for a full-time, 100% remote role (entire company is remote) for a
Staff Software Engineer, working on the ShiftUp platform stack (Python,
Pydantic AI, GCP, Temporal Workflows, Turbopuffer, Postgres). You will be one
of the first five engineering hires, and you will have the ability to grow and
shape your own role.

We need someone with solid experience designing and implementing systems with
many moving parts, who can easily shift between systems design, writing and
reviewing code (or, let's face it, supervising Codex/Cursor/Claude Code),
working with the team to design features, and talking to customers to gain
feedback and insights.

You'll be working to build all kinds of agents, workflows, and other
components to support our features. Our research agents are truly deep,
sometimes spending upwards of an hour searching and analyzing information for
a single prospect or strategy. Our RAG pipeline is focused on quality,
leveraging LLM chunking, metadata and graph generation, and contextual
embeddings.

If this sounds like fun, let's chat: you won't be asked to regurgitate
leetcode solutions, we'll simply have a conversation and see if there's a
mutual fit. Our interview process is lightweight, respectful and moves fast.
Competitive salary, equity and full benefits.

You can email me directly: ben@shiftupai.com

\---

About the company: ShiftUp is a new kind of intelligence-driven sales platform
that identifies emerging demand and drives revenue. Built from scratch to
leverage LLM-driven agentic workflows, ShiftUp deeply researches prospects,
identifies the highest-value opportunities, and provides targeted sales
strategies to execute on them.

ShiftUp is delivered as a native app on Salesforce AppExchange, providing our
platform to sellers where they already are. Our Salesforce app talks to a
cloud-native stack that uses Python services, durable workflows, and SQL +
vector databases.

We're well-funded, having recently closed a $3M seed round. We're building out
a small team of highly talented, well-rounded engineers to deliver on our
vision. Our company is 100% remote, and we use SoWork to help build our
culture. As a small startup, everyone is highly motivated and focused on
moving quickly, but we also place importance on a sustainable work-life
balance so that you can continue to do your best work.

Cards.fun | Software Engineers (Fullstack) | Remote only

We're digitizing pokemon cards and creating unprecedented financialization of
card assets. We're a small bootstrapped team. Interested in those able to
wield Claude Code effectively, and take a test-driven approach. Bonus points
if you have any interest in tokenization of RWAs. Our stack is written in
Rust, with a vanilla JS and templated HTML frontend.

Fyxed.com | Fintech Engineers | Fully Remote

Fyxed deploys capital to landlords and their property managers for cash needs
like repairs, turnovers, and improvements on rental properties.

We're at an inflection point where we have the deployment capital ($50M) to
really take a big swing at this opportunity.

The perfect candidate has prior fintech (lending) experience, loves wrangling
the complexities of reconciling/tracking money, and bonus points if you've
built on top of Column.com's API.

Email me directly: taylor at fyxed dot com

Black Hills Information Security | Senior DevOps Engineer | REMOTE

Role focuses on developing and maintaining automation for penetration testing
service infrastructure (C2, remote access, phishing, etc.).

jobTitle: Backend Engineer (with trading systems experience), Business Development Lead, Content & Growth Strategist

pod network | Competitive salary + equity | Remote | Multiple roles

Weâ€™re an early stage blockchain startup building the next generation of

Backed by a16z crypto and 1kx.

Development Lead, Content & Growth Strategist

Apply here: <https://pod.network/hiring>

postTitle: Computer Vision, Imitation Learning, Reinforcement Learning Researchers & Engineers
jobTitle: Computer Vision, Imitation Learning, Reinforcement Learning Researchers & Engineers
descContent:
ko-br | Computer Vision, Imitation Learning, Reinforcement Learning Researchers & Engineers | <https://ko-br.com> | REMOTE (Globally)

We build Physical AI models deployable today in warehouses to solve mundane
tasks like palletizing. Our tech lets robotic arms adapt to mixed SKUs, grip
slips, and chaotic environments in real time.

Have a read through our manifesto: <https://ko-br.com/manifesto>

We want you if You solve problems like an owner (no ego, no blockers). Donâ€™t
say "it wonâ€™t work." Try it. Validate it. Ship it.

Engineering roles:

    
    
      â€” You're hands-on, no theory, just building
      â€” Experienced engineer? Great! Recent grad/PhD? Don't get discouraged, apply if you're itching to ship real products
    

Why join?

    
    
      â€” Generous base + equity
      â€” Work with state-of-the-art AI and real robots (UR/ABB/KUKA/FANUC).
      â€” Build tech that solves valuable problems today.
    

About me: Ex-Amazon/Meta. Built AI from satellite imagery to nanotech SEM,
powered Alexaâ€™s vision, led ML for WhatsApp. Now building robots that adapt to
chaos.

<https://www.linkedin.com/in/ahmadbaracat>

Apply: <https://ko-br.com/careers>

DN Institute | Software Engineer | Full Remote (World)

Distributed Networks Instituteâ€™s mission is to achieve sustainable
technological growth and resilience by leveraging scientific, engineering, and
organizational principles of distributed networks. We are a part of a 501(c)3
non-profit incubator in Washington DC called BlockShop.

We just released a paid Software Development challenge with a monetary bounty
and a chance to become part of our team. It involves improving a Telegram
Connector, deployed on Cloudflare Workers (JS + Python). You can find the full
description and more information about challenge program in the Github issue
here: <https://github.com/1712n/dn-institute/issues/491>

Workmind.cloud | Cloud SysAdmin | Remote - Southeast Asia | Full-time contract

Workmind is a seed-stage startup building operational AI agents for US home
service franchises. Our agents are the product of years of experience building
and delivering AI agents for small/medium businesses, and we emphasize
reliability and consistency.

We're looking for an infrastructure engineer experienced with Google cloud to
build and monitor our DevOps, CI/CD, and data pipelines. Full job description
is at <https://workmind.cloud/jobs/reliability-eng/>

The engineering team is based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, and we strongly
prefer applicants based in Southeast Asia.

Rechat | API Engineer, Front End Engineer | Remote

Rechat is the leading AI-powered operating platform for real estate brokers
and agents. Think Shopify for real estateâ€”a mobile-first super app with
marketing automation, workflow management, and everything agents and brokers
need to run their business in one place. Weâ€™re a small, sharp team building a
big, sophisticated product without the usual corporate nonsense.

Why Youâ€™ll Like It Here:

    
    
      Remote-first with flexible hours
    
      Minimal meetingsâ€”we focus on real work
    
      No tech hype-chasingâ€”we use the right tools, not the latest trends
    
      Flat team structureâ€”no layers of bureaucracy
    

Who Weâ€™re Looking For:

    
    
      Senior Frontend Engineer (TypeScript, React) â€“ Own the UI and craft intuitive experiences
    
      Senior Backend Engineer (Node.js, PostgreSQL) â€“ Build and refine our robust, high-performance backend
    

If you thrive in small teams solving big technical challenges, reach out to
emil+hn@rechat.com.

postTitle: Senior Software Engineers, TypeScript Engineers, Fullstack Engineers, Product Manager
jobTitle: Senior Software Engineers, TypeScript Engineers, Fullstack Engineers, Product Manager
descContent:
Kilo Code | Senior Software Engineers, TypeScript Engineers, Fullstack Engineers, Product Manager | Remote | <https://jobs.ashbyhq.com/kilocode>

Kilo Code is building the fastest-evolving open-source AI coding agent to make
programming accessible to developers everywhere. Already ranked #1 on
OpenRouter, with 500K+ downloads and 4.9 trillion tokens used per month, we
combine the best features of existing AI coding tools with our own
innovations, all guided by community feedback, to create a flexible, powerful,
and user-first platform.

Weâ€™re looking for engineers and product managers who thrive in a fast-paced,
impact-driven environment. Youâ€™ll work across our full stack (Typescript +
Postgres), ship meaningful features quickly, and engage directly with our
global user community. Collaboration, creativity, and the ability to move from
idea to production at â€œKilo Speedâ€ are key.

If interested, please email your resume and best contact info to:
kyle@kilocode.ai

Qweebi | Senior Backend Engineer | Remote (IST Â±3) | Full-Time

Qweebi is building the worldâ€™s first Virtual Makerspace â€” a 3D online platform
where Kâ€“12 students can collaborate in real time to design, build, and test
high-fidelity Robotics, Engineering, and Electronics projects.

Weâ€™re looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to own backend systems, scale
infra, and ship AI-powered features. Youâ€™ll architect distributed systems,
optimize perf/latency, evolve CI/CD, and help us support thousands of
concurrent student sessions.

Please apply on: [https://careers.qweebi.com/jobs/Gw1ihJushe4x/senior-
backend-...](https://careers.qweebi.com/jobs/Gw1ihJushe4x/senior-backend-
engineer-remote)

Renaissance Philanthropy | MLE/Full-stack | Remote (worldwide)

Renaissance Philanthropy's aim is to activate a virtuous circle of increasing
ambition and impact between philanthropists and innovators: by identifying
frontier experts both in science and in new ways of solving problems; by
tapping into the growing number of emerging philanthropists; and by building
multi-sector initiatives that can harness the power of philanthropy, markets,
and governments.

RenPhil's Engineering Hub supports mission-driven, grant-funded educational
technology projects that seek to improve educational outcomes in fundamental
skills like math and reading. The Engineering Hub consists of data scientists,
machine learning engineers, and full-stack developers who collaborate with
researchers and entrepreneurs to build scalable, measurably effective tools
for teachers and students.

Weâ€™re looking for folks who:

\- can speak the languages of both research and engineering

\- are creative problem solvers

\- are comfortable with navigating ambiguity

\- want to help create a world where all children receive a high-quality
education.

If this sounds like you, please apply!

<https://www.renaissancephilanthropy.org/careers>

Class Central | Educator / Subject Matter Expert (YouTube) | Part-time | Remote | [<https://www.classcentral.com>](<https://www.classcentral.com>)

I'm looking for experienced educators, industry practitioners, and subject
matter experts who want to teach live workshops on YouTube. We're launching an
experiment: grow our YouTube channel by focusing only on intermediate-to-
advanced topics.

Class Central helps tens of millions of learners find the best courses. Small
team (6 people), profitable, independent, 13+ years.

This is genuinely experimental. You plan and lead live workshops on subjects
you know deeply. Any domain works. We promote them to our audience, and we
figure out together what clicks.

I would like to skip the content farm tactics and beginner stuff. I just want
to offer solid teaching for people ready to learn challenging subjects.

careers@classcentral.com

Darwinium | Senior Fullstack Engineer (Frontend focused) | Enterprise Fraud & Risk Management | Remote (GMT+11 â€“ Sydney) Darwinium helps some of the worldâ€™s biggest companies stop fraud before it happens â€” without breaking the experience for genuine customers. We do this through a unique edge-deployed architecture that provides real-time visibility and control across every customer journey.

Weâ€™re a VC-backed startup of 35 people, with engineering and product based in
Sydney. The founding team previously built and exited companies in the fraud
and security space (including billion-dollar outcomes).

The role: Weâ€™re looking for a senior fullstack engineer who enjoys working
across boundaries from TypeScript frontends and backend services to data
pipelines and distributed systems. Youâ€™ll work closely with our platform and
product teams to build the tools that power customer fraud detection and
orchestration. Someone who has built vscode extensions or has worked closely
in the fraud or security space would be a bonus

Our stack: Rust for the engine, ClickHouse for persistence, TypeScript (React
+ Node) for frontend and ancillary services, deployed globally at the edge.

Interested? decodeRot13(oqnirl@qnejvavhz.pbz)

Rally UXR | Remote | Full-time | Senior/Staff Backend Engineer | $190kâ€“$225k | 0.10%â€“0.50% Equity

We're building the leading User Research CRM (rallyuxr.com)

Apply here:

[https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/rally-
uxr/jobs/Ku40MR7...](https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/rally-
uxr/jobs/Ku40MR7-senior-software-engineer-backend)

\--------

At Rally, we believe talking to your users is the key to building great
products. Our platform is used by teams at Google, Figma, GitLab, MongoDB, and
more to streamline every step of the user research process in one tool.

Weâ€™re a remote-first, Series A startup with a small, senior team of builders.
While weâ€™re remote, we value connectionâ€”hosting regular in-person offsites and
providing a yearly remote office stipend.

As a Senior/Staff Backend Engineer, youâ€™ll be central to scaling Rallyâ€™s
systems to power hundreds of millions of participant records and billions of
events. Youâ€™ll own core infrastructure like email/SMS delivery, data
pipelines, search, and workflow automationâ€”and lay the foundation for new AI-
driven features.

Weâ€™re fully built in TypeScript and use AWS, Postgres, ElasticSearch, Kafka,
and Temporal. No requirements to have previous Typescript experience, but need
to be willing to learn.

Join us if you love building for scale, value craftsmanship, and want to shape
the backend foundation of a fast-growing product used by the worldâ€™s best
product teams.

postTitle: Eng (iOS/MacOS, Android, Ai/ML, Browser Extensions), Based Social Media Intern; Internships: Eng, Design, Growth
jobTitle: Eng (iOS/MacOS, Android, Ai/ML, Browser Extensions), Based Social Media Intern; Internships: Eng, Design, Growth
descContent:
Puma.tech | Remote-first with PST overlap | iOS/MacOS, Android, Ai/ML, Growth | <https://puma.tech>

Hi all, Iâ€™m Yuriy, founder of Puma.tech. Previously worked as software
engineer & developer advocate at Cloudant (YC S08, Acq. by IBM), Meteor (YC
S11), Parse (YC S11, Facebook/Meta), and explored AI/ML (computer vision for
self-driving cars).

We have two products:

1\. Puma iOS & Android â€“ browser with built in LLMs & Wallets. Private by
design.

2\. Puma AI app for Mac â€“ ChatGPT/Atlas, but with ability to pick different
model providers and fall-back to local-first ones for data privacy.

Would love your help building and growing both.

We value Optimism, Kindness, Curiosity, Speed and Grit.

Open Roles: Eng (iOS/MacOS, Android, Ai/ML, Browser Extensions), Based Social
Media Intern; Internships: Eng, Design, Growth

Weâ€™ve raised a few rounds from some of the best builders in crypto and ai:

Protocol Labs (YC S14), Chris Larsen (Ripple), Anatoly Yakovenko (Solana),
Illia Polosukhin (NEAR Protocol), Sridhar Ramaswamy (Snowflake CEO, Neeva,
Greylock), Jason Warner (poolside.ai, ex-GitHub CTO), Don Ho (Orange DAO,
Quantstamp W18), Evil Rabbit (Vercel), John Phamous (SF Compute) and other
amazing builders.

How to Apply: email _careers+hn [at] puma.tech_ with your GitHub, a note on
what you're most proud of building and what you'd like to build next.

Thank you!

Sophont Inc. | Founding Research Engineer / Scientist | Remote | Full-time

Sophont is a public-benefit corporation building open multimodal foundation
models for medicine. Joining Sophont means you are paid to lead and contribute
to high-impact medical AI research ultimately aimed to transform healthcare
and life sciences.

We are looking for exceptional, high-agency ML research engineers who are

MUZ11 | Growth Hacker/Partner | REMOTE | Revenue Share

designed for developers and professionals who listen to music while
coding/working. I'm building the default music player for focused work
sessions.

I'm seeking experienced growth hackers for a partnership role focused on
acquiring Premium subscribers. This is a 50/50 revenue share model where you
earn up to $5/month per Premium subscriber (launching this week).

SaaS \- Understanding of developer/tech professional communities \- Self-

subscriptions

revenue share. Full autonomy in your growth approach. If you build a base of
1,000 users, that's $5k/month recurring.

I'm committed to responding to all applicants. Email muz11@victorantos.com
with examples of your growth work and your approach for MUZ11.

postTitle: Senior Backend Engineer and Database Expert
jobTitle: Senior Backend Engineer and Database Expert
descContent:
PowerSync | Senior Backend Engineer and Database Expert | Full-time | Remote (opt-in regional offices)

PowerSync is a sync engine that keeps your backend database in sync with on-
device SQLite. We support Postgres, MySQL and MongoDB as source databases and
have a plethora of client SDKS, many of which are integrated with popular
libraries and frameworks on the client-side like TanStack DB, Drizzle, GRDB,
Room, etc

Detail: <https://journeyapps.com/join-us/senior-backend-engineer/>

Our team is small and polyglot, but experience with TypeScript is a must.

If you're a database enthusiast and have a solid track record of building,
deploying and maintaining backend systems on modern cloud stacks, you're
already a candidate. Also, if you're passionate about open source and synced /
local-first/offline-first apps, please apply.

Culture: We're agile and devops purists (before those terms got coopted)

features (Python/FastAPI/JS), architect scalable systems, and shape product
direction. Ideal for builders who thrive in ambiguity.

Stripe, Docker.

Strong Python fundamentals Full-stack experience (personal projects count)
Product-minded, self-directed, fast learner Nice-to-have: FastAPI/Django,
AI/ML APIs, Stripe, AWS, LaTeX/startup experience Offer:

Founding equity + competitive salary Direct founder collaboration Flexible
hours, modern tools Apply: Email resume + GitHub/portfolio + 3-5 sentence note
to info at yourtechresume.com

We have two engineering positions that we are looking to fill at Prisma. Weâ€™re
building the next-gen Postgres experience with modern DX, performance, and
scale in mind. Join our high-impact team crafting open-source and commercial
tools used by 400k+ devs/month. Weâ€™re hiring Senior Backend Engineers
(TypeScript) for our Postgres and Terminal teams. DB internals, systems

descContent:
SerpApi | <https://serpapi.com> | Junior to Senior Fullstack Engineer multiple positions | Customer Success Engineer | Hiring Coordinator | Python/Ruby/PHP/Js/Rust/Cotlin/C#/Crystal/Nim/Elixir Developer Advocate positions | Based in Austin, TX but remote-first structure | Full-time | ONSITE or FULLY REMOTE | $150K - 180K a year 1099 for US or local avg + 20% for outside the US SerpApi is the leading API to scrape and parse search engine results. We deeply support Google, Google Maps, Google Images, Bing, Baidu, and a lot more.

Our current stack is Ruby, Rails, MongoDB, and React.JS. We are looking for
more Junior and Senior FullStack Engineers. We have an awesome work
environment: We are a remote first company (before Covid!). We do continuous
integration, continuous deployments, code reviews, code pairings, profit
sharing, and most of communication is async via GitHub.

We value super strongly transparency, do open books, have a public roadmap,
and contribute to the EFF.

Apply at: <https://serpapi.com/careers>

Kadoa | Web Scraping/Software Engineer | Remote | Full-Time | <https://kadoa.com>

Weâ€™re automating web scraping at scale with AI. Web scraping used to be the
same for decades (writing and maintaining rule-based scripts for each source),
and we're fully automating that process with LLMs. We're also heavily focused
on making ethical scraping the default (robots.txt checks, rate limiting, any
custom compliance rules).

But we can't do it alone. We are looking for people who share our passion for
software craftsmanship, data, and AI. We are growing fast, have a â€œno-
bullshitâ€ policy, and try to minimize the distance between the code you write
and the customers who use it. We iterate to greatness :)

We're currently looking for a senior web scraping engineer:
<https://www.kadoa.com/careers/web-scraping-engineer>

If that sounds like you, please email me at (adrian at kadoa dot com) and
mention HN in the subject line. Ideally you include an ETL or scraping project
you've been working on in the past.

Automattic | Remote | Full-time | Multiple roles

Weâ€™re looking for engineers to help us build, grow, and maintain products used
by over a billion people each month across WordPress.com, WooCommerce,
WordPress VIP, Jetpack, Tumblr, Beeper & Texts.com, Day One, Pocket Casts, and
many more.

If you love the open web, open source, radical problem ownership, and simple
over pure solutions, Automattic is probably the place for you.

Experienced Software Engineer

    
    
      * endlessly curious about how things work â€“ infrastructure, language and libraries, product, and business
      * solves problems across any level of the stack, in any codebase
      * comfortable with using mostly PHP and JavaScript, no need to have serious experience with them
      * more info, salary, and how to apply <https://join.a8c.com/enghn> 
    

Systems Engineer

    
    
      * removes friction between developers and shipping software
      * owns availability, performance, and security
      * shares code, experience, and knowledge both internally and externally
      * more info, salary, and how to apply <https://join.a8c.com/syshn> 
    

â€¦or find something else on <https://join.a8c.com/allhn>

Localstack | REMOTE | We are a fast-growing Series A startup building cutting-edge technology to revolutionize cloud development processes and support highly efficient dev&test feedback loops. Weâ€™ve closed our last $25mil round in Q4 2024, led by Notable Capital, CRV and Heavybit.

Please check our careers website: <https://www.localstack.cloud/careers>

In particular, I'd like to highlight the Database Internals position to work
on our high-fidelity Snowflake emulator.

Senior Software Engineer - Database Internals
<https://apply.workable.com/localstack/j/5277ABA239/>

This could be a great opportunity to get into the space of data processing or
continue working in this area.

Deep States LLC | Photon-pathway-simulation for analog 35mm movie-film emulation | Florida, U.S.A | Part-time | REMOTE or local.

Deep States LLC is building the most realistic analog film-emulation system
ever created. We're bringing back the classic 35mm film stocks that defined
cinema in the 1980s.

We're modelling photon-pathways on superchip systems; to simulate the
sophisticated light-interactions between the layers in real film. We aim to
perfectly digitally-replicate the unique photo-chemical properties of
celluloid.

We're looking for self-taught C programmers with wild-eyes and a thirst for
breaking new ground. Can you perfectly model "Kodak Eastman Color Negative II
100T 5247" film stock on a rack of superchips? Let's find out.

Contact us if you want to be part of the first team to crack-the-code of
celluloid. We seek renegade coders who want to make a dent in the universe,
and have the intellectual-firepower to deliver the holy-grail: Digitally
modeling photon-pathway interactions in REAL analog film strata.

More about the project, here: <https://deepstates.io/> Email us:
us@deepstates.io

MaFi Games | Senior SWE/Game dev | Contract preferred | Remote | C#

Hi, Iâ€™m the co-founder of MaFi Games â€“ an indie studio behind the game Captain
of Industry. We are a small but passionate team who gave up their jobs at
Google and Nvidia to pursue building the best factory simulation game
possible, and we need more hands!

We are looking for an experienced software engineer to grow the team and
accelerate our progress. We strongly prefer candidates with a background in
game development, experience with 3D graphics, and performance optimizations.

Some reasons youâ€™d enjoy working with us:

* A multicultural, collaborative, and innovative work environment where your voice is heard.

* Fully remote job with flexible working hours and vacation schedule.

* Long-term full-time collaboration (not a fixed-term contract).

* High quality C# code base, code reviews, tests.

* High work satisfaction, work on a popular video game with a wonderful community.

* No bureaucracy, 1 regular meeting per week.

As an example of our technical work see <https://www.captain-of-
industry.com/post/cd-31>. We also have a unique signal-free train system:
<https://www.captain-of-industry.com/post/cd-46>

If interested, please see the detailed info,requirements, and application
instructions at <https://www.captain-of-industry.com/jobs>, thanks!

Note: We are also looking for a 2D game UI/UX designer and a SFX artist.

FetLife | Senior DevOps Engineer | Full-Time | Remote | 115k - 180k USD - <https://fetlife.com/jobs/devops-engineer>

Role: Develop and implement infrastructure upgrades, database tuning,
Kubernetes and Helm orchestration, monitoring, and security. Help maintain and
improve our large-scale Rails monolith, including CI/CD. Participate in on-
call rotation and help automate daily DevOps tasks.

Stack: MySQL/PostgreSQL, ScyllaDB, Redis, ElasticSearch, Terraform, Google

Applications: Rails, Vue.js/Typescript, Rust

How to apply: Email jointheteam+do@fetlife.com with a brief introduction, 2â€“3

Senior Product Designer | $105k - $180k USD | Design + code in HTML & CSS (Tailwind) - <https://fetlife.com/jobs/product-designer>

Product Manager (Events) | $65k - $145k USD - <https://fetlife.com/jobs/product-manager>

JetKVM builds open-source KVM-over-IP hardware that lets you control any
computer â€” BIOS and all â€” through your browser. After raising $6M on

Weâ€™re looking for a Senior Fullstack Engineer to work across our stack â€” Go,
